intro: Sphaeralcea angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, round seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. Sphaeralcea angustifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
